title: "--drive-shared-with-me" doesn't work on root directory for some commands
body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### Forum post:
https://forum.rclone.org/t/some-bugs-with-drive-shared-with-me-flag/12401

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

`--drive-shared-with-me` flag does not work as the way it should be when using without specifying any directory (Eg: `root`)

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.49.5
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.12.10

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Windows 10, 64 bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive

**What exactly is happening:**

When using the following command
````
rclone ls gdriveP: -vv --drive-shared-with-me --fast-list
````
Rclone does not show the of "Shared with me" instead it shows the files of "My Drive". But if I specify a directory belongs to "Shared with me" then it works fine, eg:
````
rclone ls gdriveP:jordan -vv --drive-shared-with-me --fast-list
````

**Debug logs:**

**When using without directory (1st command):**
````
2019/10/18 17:02:56 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.49.5" starting with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "gdriveP:" "-vv" "--drive-shared-with-me" "--fast-list" "--log-file" "rclone.log"]
2019/10/18 17:02:56 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\HARRY\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2019/10/18 17:02:59 DEBUG : 9 go routines active
2019/10/18 17:02:59 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.49.5" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "gdriveP:" "-vv" "--drive-shared-with-me" "--fast-list" "--log-file" "rclone.log"]
````

**When using with directory (2nd command):**
````
2019/10/18 17:10:33 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.49.5" starting with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "gdriveP:jordan" "-vv" "--drive-shared-with-me" "--fast-list" "--log-file" "rclone.log"]
2019/10/18 17:10:33 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\HARRY\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2019/10/18 17:10:36 DEBUG : 15 go routines active
2019/10/18 17:10:36 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.49.5" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "gdriveP:jordan" "-vv" "--drive-shared-with-me" "--fast-list" "--log-file" "rclone.log"]
````

As you can there isn't much of a difference in the logs. The only difference I could see is 1st command has **9 go routines** active while the 2nd command  has **15 go routines** active.

**TL;DR:** `--drive-shared-with-me` is ignored when using without specifying any directory. This affects **copy**, **sync**, other commands too.

However there is some other things I need to mention. When using **lsd** command then everything works fine with/without directory..!! Eg:
````
rclone lsd gdriveP: --drive-shared-with-me --fast-list
````
In the above command the directories of "Shared with me" shows without any issue. In case if you're interested in the log, here it is:

````
2019/10/18 17:18:31 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.49.5" starting with parameters ["rclone" "lsd" "gdriveP:" "--drive-shared-with-me" "--fast-list" "--log-file" "rclone.log" "-vv"]
2019/10/18 17:18:31 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\HARRY\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2019/10/18 17:18:32 DEBUG : 5 go routines active
2019/10/18 17:18:32 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.49.5" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "lsd" "gdriveP:" "--drive-shared-with-me" "--fast-list" "--log-file" "rclone.log" "-vv"]
````

**TL;DR**: The described bug does not seem to apply on `lsd` and `lsf` commands.
